html:
Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /a.doˈleːs.koː/, [a.d̪ɔˈleːs.koː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /a.doˈles.ko/, [a.d̪ɔˈlɛs.kɔ]

Etymology 1[edit]

From ad- +‎ olēscō.

Verb[edit]

adolēscō (present infinitive adolēscere, perfect active adolēvī or adoluī, supine adultum); third conjugation, no passive

  1. I grow up, become an adult
  2. I mature
  3. I increase or augment
Conjugation[edit]
  • The only attested passive forms are those from adultus, which is used in an active sense.

Descendants[edit]
  • English: adolesce
  • Esperanto: adoleski
  • Ido: adolecar
  • Portuguese: adolescer

Etymology 2[edit]

From adoleō (“burn”) +‎ -scō.

Verb[edit]

adolēscō (present infinitive adolēscere); third conjugation, no passive, no perfect or supine stem

  1. I am kindled or burn (of a sacrifice)
Conjugation[edit]
